column4: Hi, I setup a VNC server but am getting a connection error. Can someone help?
cratel : I used this tutorial https://help.ubuntu.com/community/VNC installed that using ssh. Now on windows when trying to connect it wont connect

there are lots of things to check. One, do you have a firewall in windows? 2: have you installed the vnc server in ubuntu. 3: do you have a router? 4 is this windows machine part of the home network or somewhere else?
I always check my ports here: https://www.grc.com/x/ne.dll?bh0bkyd2
lol I meant what do I type in nmap to see if it is connectable?
nmap -v -A 192.168.1.1-255 or just put in your IP address on the network.
that will show you all the open ports on your computer/network
what if I want to see from my windows computer the same info
install nmap and do the same command.
